#Text=Iran uranium talks " off to a good start "
#Text=Monday , October 19 , 2009
#Text=File : Elbaradei . png
#Text=Mohamed ElBaradei
#Text=Image : IAEA ( www.iaea.org ) .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=Talks between Iranian , Russian , French , and United States officials are " off to a good start " according to Mohamed ElBaradei , head of the United Nations ' nuclear watchdog .

#Text=The four countries met at the International Atomic Energy Agency ( IAEA ) today in Vienna , despite a statement on Iranian television shortly beforehand saying that the government would not deal directly with France , due to it previously failing to provide " nuclear materials " .

column1: #Text=The countries are working on a deal which would allow Iran to send enriched uranium to France and Russia and converted for use in a medical isotopes research reactor .
#Text=This is the first time that a deal has been worked on regarding Iran 's nuclear programme since the issue was brought up at a meeting in Geneva at the start of this month .
#Text=One concern is that Iran has not sent its atomic agency chief , an indication that a resolution of the matter may be be achieved ; nevertheless ElBaradei remained positive .
#Text=" We had this afternoon quite a constructive meeting .

#Text=Iran 's nuclear energy agency spokesman , Ali Shirzadian , said the deal would not end nuclear enrichment activities , as it was not  economically feasible " to purify further low enriched uranium itself to the 130-300kg yield required , adding this was an option if talks " do not bring about Iran 's desired result " .

column1: #Text=Sanctions
#Text=Iran escaped further UN sanctions after talks in Geneva earlier this month .

#Text=It agreed to IAEA inspections of a hidden nuclear site , believed to be near the holy city of Qom and to send nuclear material to Russia and France for processing , part of the deal being negotiated at the Vienna talks .
#Text=According to Western officials , Iran already agreed tentatively in Geneva to major points , but this is denied by Iran .
#Text=According to a Western diplomat , who wished to remain anonymous , the talks this week were supposed to seal the deal . "

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=But , since we have had no negotiations thus far with the Iranians , the next couple of days could reopen a lot of what we hoped was already agreed in principle ,  he added .
